entry.title: How to Delete Test Execution
entry.content:
We accidentally created test executions that we would like to delete.  They are skewing our test statistics since they will not be deleted.  

Steps to reproduce: 

  1. Start a test execution from a test case.  
  2. Also, start a test execution from a test plan with the same test case as above.
  3. Try to delete the test execution from step one while keeping the exectution from step two.  



------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How to batch print journal entries in Manage Journal...
entry.content:
Hello @jason_su 

Thanks for checking. Unfortunately, I cannot provide a live screenshot of your tenant. Sorry about that. But here IS what you should see in App F0744A ‚Äì Manage Lease Contracts (Public Cloud)

The Upload option may not be visible by default. It appears only if your business role has the necessary permissions for uploading lease Contracts. In many customer systems, this permission is included in the SAP_BR_RENTAL_ACCOUNTANT role or a custom role derived from it.

If you only see Display and Create but not upload, ask your key user or administrator to verify the business catalogue SAP_REFX_CNTR_MGMT_PC and confirm if the Upload action is assigned.

Please note that the Upload function is only accessible in specific app views, such as the contract list screen. When you open an individual contract directly, the upload button will not be visible.

Feel free to reach out if you need further information

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Part time email notification alert not triggered
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

Good day to you.

We have this requirement for HR started the transfer process, working hours to be changed to limited/unlimited in this case limited, HR to approve. Employee and manager as well gets the notification.

Job info:
Event reason-transfer

1. Approver HR
CC: Manager and employee

1st Reminder to HR and employee: 28days before expiration
Part Time Contract for [[SUBJECT_USER]] is ending in 28 days. Please talk to your supervisor or go into the system to extend it or change it to a different model.

2nd Reminder to HR: 14 days before expiration

All the necessary configuration has been setup in the system (workflow, alert message, business rule and assigned into the job info).

New Part time contract ending 28days is setup with condition working hours equals to limited and event reason transfer.

We have done the testing from our end, however, still did not receive the part time email notification alert.

Kindly advise.

Thank you.

entry.title: Re: ÂÆ¢Êà∑ÂØπS/4HANA Public CloudÁöÑË¥¶Â•óÈúÄÊ±Ç
entry.content:
Hello @JuliaLu ,

According to your requirement, it seems the parallel accounting requirement is as follow: one ledger for group accounting principle (Austria GAAP), one ledger for local ledger (Local GAAP) and one ledger group valuation(4G).

For parallel accounting, the recommendation is:
Leading ledger 0L  -> corporate accounting principle (IFRS/USGAAP or country/region-specific accounting principle)
Non-leading ledger 2L or 3L -> country/region-specific accounting principle(s).

The delivered system default is that the leading ledger is assigned to the local accounting principle, as a local ledger is always needed and you could have one ledger only. As soon as you have more than one ledger, SAP recommendation is to change this default. This means that you need to change the default assignments in configuration as shown above.

For your case:

0L -> Austria GAAP , maintain at corp AccPr level

2L-> Local GAAP, maintain at company code level

Please also note that you can only change the assignment of accounting principles to ledgers and company codes before the first posting in the system.

Reference: 

3530183 - Assigning Accounting Principles to Ledgers and Company Codes in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition: Details on Configuration in General Ledger Accounting and Asset Accounting - SAP for Me

Question 16~22 in the In-Depth are suitable for your case:

In-Depth with SAP S/4HANA ‚Äì Ledger Scoping Q&A - SAP Community

Kind Regards,

entry.title: Differences in planed cost of raw materials between cost estimation and production order
entry.content:
Dear all:

I have question about differences in planed cost of raw materials between cost estimation and production order Analysis.

For the finished product ZFG004, First I conducted Manage Material Cost EstimatesÔºå

The amount in  Purchasing Info Records for raw materials is 1800/PC, and each cost requires 10 raw materials. Therefore, the direct cost of raw materials for ZFG004 is 18000/PC,
But when I created the production order for ZFG004, the planned cost of producing 10 ZFG004 was 180100, which was different from my expectations 180000.

I went to check the raw material master data and found that its previous average price is 1801JPY. Therefore, the planned price of the raw material for production order analysis is taken as the previous average price of the raw material, instead of the price in the purchase information record as in the standard price evaluation? Is it rightÔºü

Thank you and best regards.

Wang

entry.title: Re: Connect SAP Workflow Sevice in the NEO environment to My Inbox on-premise
entry.content:
Hello,

although it has been a while since the last comment and the blog entry is quite old, I would like to make this response because I believe there are still many people out there looking for a solution to integrate cloud workflows into the on-premise Fiori inbox.

According to latest update of the SAP note 3071334 that refers to this blog entry, SAP still can not offer a standard integration approach.

However, since one of last updates to the SAP Build Process Automation Workflow API, we have been finally able to manage to successfully integrate our SAP Process Automation based approval tasks into the Fiori on-premise inbox on a project basis! To do this, we implemented a custom task provider for the on-premise Fiori Inbox, that queries the user's SBPA tasks and displays them in the Fiori Inbox. This allows us to use the on-premise Fiori Inbox as a true central task inbox again.

If you are also still looking for an integration option, please take a look at the current spec for the SAP Process Automation Workflow API in the SAP Business Accelerator Hub.

Best regards
Markus

entry.title: Re: ByDesign Extension Scenario modify
entry.content:
Hi,

The extension scenario in patch solution that has been assembled in a previous version of the Solution. You are not allowed to do the changes because existing data will become inconsistent if you modify an existing extension scenario.

You can create an additional Process Extension Scenario and add it to the element annotation.

Please review below help document.

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_CLOUD_APPLICATIONS_STUDIO/cbcebe3cfb1647a8b0322c18dbb0b481/73548c1a73e21014a9d5d0378a32b555.html?locale=en-US&state=PRODUCTION&version=CLOUD

Vivek

entry.title: Re: Differences in planed cost of raw materials between c...
entry.content:
Go to ck13n, input material ZFG004, plant code, Costing variant. There check for

  • Raw material cost: Expand the structure to see each component.
  • Price source: Click on the raw material ‚Üí check the origin (Purchasing Info Record, Standard Price, Moving Average).
  • Costing lot size: Confirm it‚Äôs 1 PC or 10 PC ‚Äî this affects scaling.

Use the ‚ÄúCost Component Split‚Äù view to see how much is attributed to raw materials, overhead, etc.

entry.title: How to define the scrap value?
entry.content:
The customer wants to know how to check the scrap value?


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How to define the scrap value?
entry.content:
When maintaining the depreciation area-specific asset master data, you can specify an absolute scrap value, and/or a percentage rate, in the detail screen of each depreciation area. If you enter both, the system uses the percentage by default.

If a cutoff value key is assigned to the depreciation key, the system ignores the cutoff value percentage of the key and treats the amount entered in the asset master record as the scrap value.

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/3e5fcf2c768746049b5627bd5a42f720/8f2cd25320cd4608e10000000a174cb4.html?version=LATEST&locale=en-US

entry.title: Goodbye UI5 Tooling - Hello UI5 CLI!
entry.content:
Over the last decade, UI5 Tooling became the best-in-class tool to develop UI5 projects. It offers a range of features to make your life as a developer easy when serving and building projects using the powerful UI5 framework. In this blogpost, I'll explain the reasons behind the renaming of "UI5 Tooling" to "UI5 CLI".

 

History 

In 2018, when we released the initial version of UI5 Tooling, we used the rather technical-sounding term "UI5 Build and Development Tooling". Already in 2018, we had several discussions about which name would fit best for the project and at that point in time we came up with the shortened term "UI5 Tooling".  

Right from the beginning, we've designed UI5 Tooling modular and extensible, which led to a large and highly engaged community offering various extensions. It's amazing to see how many builder tasks and server middlewares are developed and maintained by the UI5 community. The UI5 community plays a crucial role in the whole UI5 ecosystem. Currently, UI5 Tooling comprises six packages, namely @ui5/cli, @ui5/server, @ui5/builder, @ui5/project, @ui5/fs and @ui5/logger. Despite this modularization, most developers only use@ui5/cli, which includes all the other packages. As you might notice, there is no package name including the term "tooling". This led to the situation that many developers talk about "UI5 CLI" when in fact talking about UI5 Tooling. So we're having two terms for the same project, which is not ideal.  

In 2019, the first version of SAP Fiori tools was released. SAP Fiori tools is a project developed by SAP and offering a wide range of tools to develop SAP Fiori applications more efficiently. It's not only focusing on UI5 but also on further aspects, such as e.g. SAP Fiori elements. SAP Fiori tools contains UI5 Tooling and puts additional functionality on top. If you develop an SAP Fiori application, SAP Fiori tools is the right choice for you. In the meantime, some modules of SAP Fiori tools have also been open-sourced. In 2019, SAP Fiori Tools decided to choose "@sap/ux-ui5-tooling" as its package name, which highlights perfectly the close relationship to the underlying UI5 Tooling project. However, these similar names led to a lot of confusion in the SAP customer and open-source community base. There is no "@ui5/tooling" package on npmjs.org but a package called "@sap/ux-ui5-tooling", which is not UI5 Tooling but actually SAP Fiori tools. That's confusing.  

 

Motivation 

Over the last years, it turned out that keeping the term UI5 Tooling led to much confusion on the consumer side, which then resulted in an increasing support effort on our side. So, we made up our minds over several iterations about what would be the best new name for our tool. Finally, we settled on the term UI5 CLI as our successor term for UI5 Tooling.

 

Good to know 

First, and very importantly, this rename does not affect / disrupt your coding. The packages published on npmjs.org won't change their names.  

Over the next weeks, we'll migrate https://github.com/SAP/ui5-tooling to its new home on the newly created UI5 GitHub organization, and we'll ensure that any old links will be redirected to the new location. As soon as the new repository is available, we recommend updating your bookmarks. We'll use this new repository as a monorepo containing all UI5 CLI-related projects. The other UI5 CLI-related repositories will stay on the SAP GitHub organization and hold the source code for Version 4 and prior releases. The new monorepo will contain the source code for the next major version, for which we'll start the development phase soon, as well as the documentation for all UI5 CLI releases. 

There are already plenty of new features planned for UI5 CLI and we're looking forward to giving you an update on them soon. 

Note: We'll add the URLs of the new repository landscape here as soon as they're available.

Is there a standard way to configure this in FSM (through roles, filters, or permissions), or do we need a specific customization?

Any guidance or best practices would be appreciated.

Thanks in advance,
aziz

entry.title: Re: SAP S/4 Public Cloud - Historical Balances Migration...
entry.content:
Hello @Luis_Amaral_Rib43 

Thank you for your question. I‚Äôve reviewed your scenario, and what you are seeing is standard system behaviour in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition.

Why is the opening balance zero?

The migration object FI ‚Äì Historical Balances posts balances as periodic entries within the chosen fiscal year. These are visible in reports such as Display G/L Account Balances.

However, these postings do not create an opening balance for the next financial year.

The ‚ÄúOpening Balance‚Äù line in the reports is filled only by the Balance Carryforward process (in on-premise this is FAGLGVTR; in Public Cloud this is either scheduled automatically at year-end or triggered via the Carry forward G/L Balances app).

If you load balances into period 12/2024, the system treats them as actual postings for 2024. When the year-end carryforward runs, these balances are reclassified into period 0/2025. That is why loading directly into 2025 does not populate the opening balance line.

What this means for your project

There is no supported way to migrate balances directly as an ‚Äúopening balance‚Äù for 2025.

The recommended approach is:

Use the migration object to load balance up to fiscal year 2024.

Run the Balance Carryforward (automatically or via Carryforward G/L Balances).

The system will then generate the opening balances for 2025, which will appear correctly in reporting.

SAP Help Portal ‚Äì Migrate Historical G/L Account Balances

SAP Help Portal ‚Äì Carryforward G/L Balances

In summary

You are not doing anything wrong. The zero-opening balance for 2025 is expected if you try to migrate it directly. The correct process is to migrate up to 2024 and then let the system‚Äôs carry-forward logic generate the opening balance for 2025.

Let me know if you need further information

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: How to restrict external planner to see only assigned...
entry.content:
Discuss with your Security team and check for the below option

Have a separate role for your External Planner. Restrict access only to view activities assigned to them. Key permission for Activity.Read, set to ‚ÄúAssigned to me‚Äù or ‚ÄúAssigned to my resource‚Äù. Further, in the Activity List view, apply a default filter like Assigned Technician = [Current User]. You can set this as a default filter for the role so external planners always see only their own activities.

entry.title: How to use Standard Que time in work center for maintenance order operation scheduling.
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

Need your inputs and suggestions on how to achieve the scheduling of maintenance order operation with Standard que time field value within the work center master scheduling tab.

Example:

We have work center "Mechanical", in scheduling tab we have field Std Que time value filled with 2HR.

We have work center "Electrical", in scheduling tab we have field Std Que time value filled with 3HR.

and now we have order with several operations with the above work centers.

In general the scheduling will happen as below.

Mechanical - Operations 1 - 5Hrs - start time 08:00:00 end time 13:00:00

Mechanical - Operations 2 - 2Hrs - start time 13:00:00 end time 15:00:00

Electrical - Operations 3 - 1Hrs - start time 15:00:00 end time 16:00:00

 

Now requirement is like below

Mechanical - Operations 1 - 5Hrs - start time 08:00:00 end time 13:00:00  + 2HR Que time

Mechanical - Operations 2 - 2Hrs - start time 15:00:00 end time 17:00:00  + 2HR Que time

Electrical - Operations 3 - 1Hrs - start time 19:00:00 end time 20:00:00

que time should be considered for each operation, even if the work center for next operation is changed then the que time of that work center should be considered.

The request is for they wanted a que time for transfer of that equipment from one work center to another work center. So operation cannot be started immediately after the completion of first operation.

Please provide your thoughts to achieve this requirement.

entry.title: Experience data in SAP Signavio Process Intelligence: new strategic partnership with Medallia
entry.content:
First introduced as part of our April 2025 product release, we shared a new technology partnership with Medallia, a market leader in experience management. This collaboration is designed to help organizations take the next step in process mining by seamlessly combining operational data with human experience data, delivering a more holistic view of business processes and the people impacted by them. 

In this blog, we‚Äôll take a closer look at the partnership and explore how this collaboration brings added value to you by delivering more human-centric insights across your processes. 

From data to insight: the power of experience in process analysis 

Traditionally, process mining has focused on analyzing system-generated data such as event logs. But in today‚Äôs experience-driven competitive environment, that‚Äôs no longer enough. Businesses must also understand how customers, suppliers, and employees experience the process as they move through it. 

This is where Medallia and SAP Signavio come together. Medallia enables organizations to collect rich omnichannel experience data, which include but not limited to survey responses, feedback forms, conversation transcripts and digital behavioural signals. SAP Signavio Process Intelligence then ingests this experience data and correlates it with operational event logs, creating a powerful bridge between people and process. 

A seamless integration via SAP Integration Suite 

Customers using Medallia can now bring their experience data directly into SAP Signavio Process Intelligence. This can be done using various connectivity options available in SAP Signavio, with the recommended approach being through SAP Integration Suite which is a comprehensive, cloud-native integration platform that enables businesses to connect applications, data, and processes securely across on-premise, cloud, and hybrid landscapes with prebuilt connectors, APIs, and intelligent automation. 

An integration package is already available on SAP Business Accelerator Hub as a community release, making it easy to get started. This package includes pre-built integration flows, artifacts, and detailed documentation that can be directly used, configured, and customized to meet specific customer requirements. 

Unlocking new AI-powered insights 

Once the data is inside SAP Signavio Process Intelligence, customers can use the  AI-assisted context analyzer (currently in beta) to extract deeper meaning from qualitative experience data. Two key features are now available: 

Text-to-Event matching: Matches feedback data with specific process events, assuming a common identifier (e.g., Case ID). This enables direct mapping of human feedback to process steps and is visualized using the process discovery widget. 

Sentiment analysis: Automatically labels each experience data entry (e.g., survey comment) as positive, negative, or neutral, and integrates this AI-generated column into the event log. These sentiment insights can then be visualized and analyzed using the table widget, alongside other process performance metrics. 

Of course, all other widgets and visualization tools in SAP Signavio Process Intelligence remain fully available, allowing teams to layer sentiment and feedback insights across broader process analyses. 

Why this matters 

Combining Medallia‚Äôs experience data with SAP Signavio‚Äôs powerful process mining capabilities means businesses no longer have to choose between operational excellence and customer satisfaction. With this integration, you can: 

  • Make decisions based not just on efficiency, but on how people experience your processes 
  • Detect pain points earlier, across the customer journey, supplier onboarding, or employee workflows 
  • Drive transformation that‚Äôs truly human-centered 

Ready to get started? 

Medallia is listed on SAP store where you can learn more about its capabilities. 
If you're already using both Medallia and SAP Signavio, reach out to explore how you can unlock the full potential of this integration.  
Together, SAP Signavio and Medallia are redefining what it means to truly understand your processes, from the inside and outside.

entry.title: Hide/Disable the Select option range in extension
entry.content:
TYPE-POOLS : scarr.
TABLES: scarr.

DATA: wa_res TYPE sscr_restrict,
wa_option_list TYPE sscr_opt_list,
wa_ass TYPE sscr_ass.

INITIALIZATION.
PERFORM initialization.

FORM initialization .
DATA: lv_program TYPE sy-repid,
wa_restriction TYPE sscr_restrict.

lv_program = sy-repid.
wa_option_list-name = 'S_TOEML'.
wa_option_list-options-eq = 'X'.
APPEND wa_option_list TO wa_res-opt_list_tab.

wa_option_list-name = 'S_CCEML'.
wa_option_list-options-eq = 'X'.
APPEND wa_option_list TO wa_res-opt_list_tab.

wa_ass-kind = 'S'.
wa_ass-name = 'S_TOEML'.
wa_ass-sg_main = 'I'.
wa_ass-op_main = 'S_TOEML'.
APPEND wa_ass TO wa_res-ass_tab.

wa_ass-kind = 'S'.
wa_ass-name = 'S_CCEML'.
wa_ass-sg_main = 'I'.
wa_ass-op_main = 'S_CCEML'.
APPEND wa_ass TO wa_res-ass_tab.
*wa_restriction

CALL FUNCTION 'SELECT_OPTIONS_RESTRICT'
EXPORTING
program = sy-repid
restriction = wa_res
* DB = ' '
EXCEPTIONS
too_late = 1
repeated = 2
selopt_without_options = 3
selopt_without_signs = 4
invalid_sign = 5
empty_option_list = 6
invalid_kind = 7
repeated_kind_a = 8
OTHERS = 9.
IF sy-subrc <> 0.
MESSAGE ID sy-msgid TYPE sy-msgty NUMBER sy-msgno
WITH sy-msgv1 sy-msgv2 sy-msgv3 sy-msgv4 DISPLAY LIKE 'E'.
ENDIF.
ENDFORM.

entry.title: GTS e4H: Incorrect Export and Shipping Date Assignment in Automatic GTS Document Creation (USA)
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I have the following problem ‚Äì When an invoice from ERP is transferred to GTS for the USA, an export document is automatically created. That is correct so far. During this process, the registration date, export date, and shipping date are set. The registration date is correct, but the export date is incorrectly set to several days in the past with a timestamp of 00:00:00 EST. That is wrong. The export date must not be earlier than the registration date and must not have a zero timestamp. The shipping date is also set to the export date and is therefore equally incorrect. The FTO and the SIT are in the same time zone. If I manually create an export declaration for the USA with the same data, the date and timestamp are correct. Where could I look for the error? Has anyone experienced this before? üôÇ I would appreciate any tips.

Best Wishes

entry.title: Re: how to handle discount on fixed price customer project?
entry.content:
Hello @Meenu_Wavie 

Thank you for your question. This behaviour is common in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud.

Why DCM2 works only for T&E
The discount condition DCM2 (Customer Project Discount) is part of the standard pricing process for T&E (PSP0) projects, which is why it applies there. However, for Fixed Price (PNG1) projects, this condition is not included in the provided pricing process, so no discount is applied.

How to enable discounts for Fixed Price
In Public Cloud, pricing procedures cannot be edited directly. Instead, you must use Central Business Configuration (CBC) ‚Äî specifically, the Price Calculation activities ‚Äì to add a discount condition (such as DCM2 or a custom condition) to the pricing setup for Fixed Price projects.

Output forms
The default output format is Project Billing ‚Äì Customer Invoice (SAP Billing Document Output), which shows gross price, discount, and net price. If you require the specific format ‚Äúprice ‚Üí discount ‚Üí final amount" as you described, you can copy and modify the form in the Form Template Maintenance app.

SAP Help Portal ‚Äì Form Template Maintenance

SAP Learning/Adding the Maintain Form Templates App to the SAP Fiori Launchpad

SAP Help-Plan Customer Projects

Discounts are automatically applied for T&E. For Fixed Price, however, you must set up a discount condition in CBC, and the invoice form will display the discount lines once they are included in the pricing.

Let me know if you need further information

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: service item in US localization sap b1
entry.content:
Hi @ana2001 ,

Can you please share screenshots of your Item Master? Where exactly are you setting it up as "service"? If this is a Service you provide/sell, you need to mark it as a "Sales Item", which means you don't control stock and don't use it as purchased services. However, if the item master has already been used, you cannot change its type from stock (inventory) to non-stock (service) and vice versa. Check whether this is your case.

 

BR,
Felipe

entry.title: Re: #Error getting last refresh variable for few users
entry.content:
Hi Ramesh, we have been facing with same issue almost 2 years ago, had a call with SAP and they tried to convict me thats logical and working as expected...

 

Create the variable similar to mine:

=If GetPreferredViewingLocale() = "pl_PL" 
Then Replace([cost];" ";"")
ElseIf GetPreferredViewingLocale() = "en_US" 
Then Replace(Replace(Replace([cost];" ";"");",";"");".";",")

But in your case you have to force SAP BO to read correct Date Format. Diffrent for en_US and diffrent for en_UK.

Hope that will help!

entry.title: Seamless Integration of Google Cloud BigQuery with SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC): Step-by-Step Guide
entry.content:
On a recent project, I integrated Google Cloud BigQuery with SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC). After exploring both platforms, I‚Äôve put together a simple, step-by-step guide‚Äîplus a few key features‚Äîto help you connect them quickly. BigQuery handles huge datasets with speed, while SAC turns that data into clear reports, dashboards, and plans. Together, they take you from raw numbers to smarter decisions.

In this blog, I‚Äôll show you exactly how to set up the integration‚Äîfrom creating a table in BigQuery to keeping your SAC model updated and refreshed.

Key Benefits of BigQuery‚ÄìSAC Integration

  • Seamless Cloud-to-Cloud Integration ‚Äì No complex middleware; connect directly between GCP and SAC.
  • Analytics Made Simple: SAC lets you turn data into dashboards, forecasts, and actionable insights.
  • Faster Decision-Making ‚Äì SAC visualizations update as soon as data refreshes, giving near real-time insights.
  • Collaboration Made Easy ‚Äì SAC allows teams across finance, operations, and strategy to work with the same live data.
  • Automation ‚Äì Schedule regular refreshes so your dashboards and reports stay up to date automatically.

Prerequisites

Before we dive in, you‚Äôll need:

  1. A Google Cloud project with BigQuery enabled.
  2. Access to an SAP Analytics Cloud tenant with permissions to create models and connections.
  3. A BigQuery dataset and an SAC model that share the same schema. (The column data types in BigQuery must match the dimensions and measures in your SAC model.)

Step 1: Create a Table in Google BigQuery

  1. Open GCP Console and navigate to BigQuery Studio.
  2. Create a Dataset within your GCP project.
  3. Within the dataset, create a Table and define its schema. Ensure the schema aligns with the structure of your SAC model (synchronized dimensions and measures). Since I created a table with multiple data types, you can see its schema in the image below.

  4. Populate the table with data if it‚Äôs empty. You can do this via:

    • Python Notebook in GCP .
    • Manual uploads (CSV/JSON).

Example workflow to load data into a BigQuery table (if it has no existing data): Navigate to 'Notebooks' within your GCP project, open a new notebook, load the data using Python, and then verify that the table is populated with the required test or business data. For this example, I loaded some test data into the table using Python code in a notebook.       

Step 2: Prepare the Model in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC)

  1. Log in to SAP Analytics Cloud.
  2. Navigate to Modeler and create a Blank Model.
  3. Ensure the model structure (dimensions and measures) matches the BigQuery table schema.The image below shows the measures and dimensions, with data types matching those in the BigQuery table.

Step 3: Create a Connection Between SAC and BigQuery

  1. In SAC, go to Main Menu > Connections.
  2. Click on Add Connection (+).
  3. Choose Google BigQuery.
  4. Sign in using the same Google account linked to your GCP project.
  5. Once authenticated, select the relevant Project from the dropdown.
  6. Save the connection. You‚Äôve now linked SAC with your BigQuery environment.

Step 4: Import Data from BigQuery into SAC

  1. Navigate to your SAC model and open Data Management.
  2. Select Import Job.
  3. Choose Google BigQuery as the data source.
  4. Select the connection you created earlier.

      5. Choose between:

  • Freehand SQL Query (for custom queries).
  • Build a Query (drag-and-drop interface) (For most use cases, Build a Query works best: - Select your dataset and table. - Add all required dimensions and measures. - Finalize your query). Here, I chose the Build a Query option, as shown in the image below.

6.  Configure the import job by:

  • Preparing the data.
  • Mapping dimensions to facts
  • Reviewing and confirming the import steps.

7. Run the import. Once completed, SAC will display a success notification along with row-level details in the job timeline.

Step 5: Validate the Imported Data

  1. Navigate back to your Model Structure Workspace in SAC.
  2. Verify that the data has been successfully imported.
  3. Ensure measures and dimensions are mapped correctly.
  4. Test the model with basic visualizations or planning functions to confirm accuracy.
  5. As shown in the image below, the entire BigQuery table is now visible in the Data Foundation area.

Step 6: Refresh and Schedule Your Import Job

One-time imports are fine for demos, but real business data changes constantly. Luckily, SAC lets you refresh and schedule updates:

  • Update: Brings in the latest changes while keeping existing data.
  • Append: Adds new rows without touching what‚Äôs already there.
  • Clean and Replace: Wipes the old dataset and replaces it with fresh data.

You can also schedule refreshes (daily, weekly, or custom) so your dashboards are always up to date ‚Äî no manual work required.

Key Takeaways

  • Integration is straightforward once the schemas in BigQuery and SAC are aligned.
  • BigQuery serves as a powerful backend, while SAC empowers users with visualization and planning tools.
  • Refresh options and scheduling help keep your models in sync automatically

Conclusion

Integrating Google BigQuery with SAP Analytics Cloud isn‚Äôt complicated, but it‚Äôs incredibly powerful. With just a few steps, you can combine BigQuery‚Äôs scalable data engine with SAC‚Äôs interactive analytics and planning features. Whether you‚Äôre experimenting with test data or working at an enterprise level, the process is the same: build your table, set up your model, connect, import, validate, and schedule updates.

By following the steps in this guide, you can set up the integration with ease and keep your models refreshed automatically.

entry.title: Re: Need to connect B1 Client from Remote PC
entry.content:
Dear SurangaWe,
 
In SAP Business One Cloud cross-domain user authentication is not supported. See SAP Note 2450265 - Cross-domain User Authentication Is not Supported in SAP Business One Cloud for your reference.
Therefore please ensure that all machines will be in the same domain.
After that please proceed with following chapters from Administrator's Guide - SAP Business One Cloud:

6.4 Registering Browser Access Servers
7.2 Registering Software Components to Existing Service Units

Thank you.
 
Kind regards,
Ladislav
SAP Support

entry.title: Re: How can I retrieve through the Service Layer the quan...
entry.content:
Hi @RonaldoCJunior ,

I don't think that the Service Layer natively provides a direct endpoint to retrieve batch quantities distributed per warehouse.

In those cases, I simply create a view, fetching data from the batch/warehouse tables, ending with B1SLQuery (i.e., MyWhsBatchB1SLQuery), and expose it via the following endpoint:

POST https://<server>:50000/b1s/v2/SQLViews('<view name>')/Expose

Then I call it using:

GET https://<server>:50000/b1s/v2/view.svc/<view name>

Have a look at the SAP's official documentation: SQL View Exposure | SAP Help Portal

I hope it helps.

BR,
Felipe

entry.title: How to update multiple entities in a single OData $batch request.
entry.content:
• I am sending one  $batch request with multipart/mixed format.

  • Inside, you created one changeset with 3 PATCH requests.

  • SAP will execute all 3 updates together.

  • If one fails (e.g. invalid IBAN), the whole changeset is rolled back.

 

 

--batch_001
Content-Type: multipart/mixed; boundary=changeset_001

--changeset_001
Content-Type: application/http
Content-Transfer-Encoding: binary

PATCH A_BusinessPartner('XXXX') HTTP/1.1
Content-Type: application/json

{
"BusinessPartnerCategory": "X",
"BusinessPartnerGrouping": "XXXX"
}
--changeset_001
Content-Type: application/http
Content-Transfer-Encoding: binary

PATCH A_BusinessPartnerAddress(BusinessPartner='XXXX',AddressID='XXX') HTTP/1.1
Content-Type: application/json

{
"CityName": "Dubai",
"PostalCode": "00000"
}
--changeset_001
Content-Type: application/http
Content-Transfer-Encoding: binary

PATCH A_BusinessPartnerBank(BusinessPartner='XXXX',BankIdentification='XXXX') HTTP/1.1
Content-Type: application/json

{
"BankName": "XXXXXXXXX",
"IBAN": "XXXXXXXXXXX"
}

--changeset_001--
--batch_001--

entry.title: Solution Documentation with Pictures: A Practical Guide for SAP Signavio
entry.content:
High-quality process documentation goes beyond text. In SAP Signavio, you can enrich your processes by uploading documents and pictures directly into the file storage and linking them to your diagrams. This makes your process models more tangible, supports knowledge transfer, and ensures that all stakeholders have the same visual understanding.

Recently, one of our customers who was manually documenting their solutions in SAP Cloud ALM approached us  with the question: Can this be automated in SAP Signavio or at least partially automated  

This real-world scenario inspired us to first outline the customer‚Äôs current approach and then explore how SAP Signavio can be leveraged to make documentation more efficient and effective.

In this guide, we will walk you through the step-by-step process of uploading images into SAP Signavio, linking them to your processes, and even generating reports that include these visuals. Along the way, we‚Äôll highlight important considerations such as file size limits, storage quotas, and best practices for hosting images to avoid broken links.

By the end, you‚Äôll be able to create more engaging and efficient documentation and see how SAP Signavio can help transform manual work into smarter, collaborative process documentation.

Step 1) Think about what should be included in your Solution Documentation and create a reporting template. SAP Signavio provides a template for process documentation, but you may also want to design your own. Deep dive HERE

Create a new Template

Step 2) In our scenario, I want to include one screenshot for each task in the process to show where the activity takes place within the respective application. For example, the task ‚ÄúCreate goods receipt‚Äù.

This task takes place in an SAP S/4HANA system. To add the corresponding screenshot, we select the task and navigate to ‚ÄúDocumentation.‚Äù

There, the screenshot is inserted. Please note that there is a disclaimer at the end of the blog post regarding the upload and use of images, where we explain the applicable limitations and requirements.

 

After the upload, you also have the option to adjust the image to the correct size.

Nach dem Upload besteht auch die Option das Bild auf die korrekte Gr√∂√üe anzupassen.

Step 3) Generate the report. Go to the Process Manager and automatically generate your Solution Documentation.

Make sure that you have selected your template.

Pick the Process where you want to generate a report and click ‚ÄúGenerate documentation‚Äù. 

 

After a few moments you have a PDF ready to use.

When you open the PDF, you see at the task ‚ÄúCreate goods receipt‚Äù this. The information‚Äôs around the picture/screenshot are based on the attributes in Signavio so the quality depend on how good you are maintain your processes in Signavio.

You can add your screenshots also on different other ways like the dictionary or an own attribute.

 

Disclaimer

Please note the following limitations when working with images in SAP Signavio documentation:

  • Images that are not accessible to all users may appear as broken links if the necessary permissions or log-ins are missing.

  • To avoid this, we recommend embedding images only as:

    • Unlisted images (with hidden names and implicit authentication tokens, HTTPS only), e.g.
      https://external.domain.com/files/hidden-file-name-nobody-guesses?possibleToken=123nekot321

    • Publicly hosted images (without access or authentication restrictions, HTTPS only), e.g.
      https://external.domain.com/files/my_image.png

  • Be aware that externally hosted images may potentially be accessed by third parties.

If you want to use more images than 10GB you can also create the report as an word file and add the images via copy paste. This is not a super good alternativ, but then you have a standard report and only the work of adding the pictures manually. When you read the intro again you see that we are coming from a use case where you have 100% manual work.  

  • Storage limits also apply:

    • Maximum available storage: 10 GB

    • Maximum single file size: 32 MB

    • Only HTTPS links are supported for external images‚ÄÉ

Alternativ Step "4" Workaround with the Word File
If you want more flexibility in editing your Solution Documentation, you can export the generated report to a Word file. This allows you to adjust formatting, add further explanations, or insert screenshots and graphics that go beyond the default template. Once finished, the document can be shared with stakeholders or uploaded again into the SAP Signavio file storage for central access.

Summary & Outlook

In this use case, our customer currently documents solutions for SAP Cloud ALM manually, including the collection of screenshots and descriptions for each process task. While this approach works, it requires significant manual effort, is prone to errors, and makes it difficult to maintain a consistent documentation standard across teams.

By leveraging SAP Signavio, documentation can be streamlined and partially automated. Screenshots and supporting documents can be uploaded directly into the file storage, linked to process tasks, and included automatically in generated reports. With the right reporting template, organizations ensure a consistent structure while reducing repetitive work.

Our solution can take this even further by exploring automation options ‚Äî for example, integrating with SAP S/4HANA to capture screenshots or system steps automatically, or pre-populating process documentation fields through standardized templates. This reduces manual overhead, improves quality, and enables scalable, audit-ready documentation.

In short, we can help transform documentation from a manual, error-prone task into a smart, collaborative, and partially automated process powered by SAP Signavio.

entry.title: Detail with Previous() shows incorrect value due to wrong order
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

we have report which shows the values and in the column next to it shows values for previous row.
Those variables shows correctly values. For some reason I needed to create detail which will show same values.

 

I have created variable and it almost works... The problem is once the example got more than 10 changes the previous function shows incorrect value. From my perspective it shows values in that order 1,10,11,12,3,4,6,8 etc etc. The problem is that in table its work fine, but I have no idea how to "sort" those records in detail.

 

[Value] =[Numeric Value]

[Value previous] =Previous([Numeric Value];([Agreement]))

[test_detal (previous)] =Previous([Numeric Value];([Agreement])) In ([Unique no];[Agreement];[Expiry Month])

[test detal (previous)] has set dimension at [Unique no] object

Is there any chance to solve that issue? 
FYI: In SQL query I sorted those records in correct way and main table shows it correctly. Only issue is with previous function in detail...

entry.title: Re: Differences in planed cost of raw materials between c...
entry.content:
Yes you are correct. The planned cost in a production order is derived from the Valuation price of the raw material at the time the order is created. This valuation price can either be Standard Price or Moving Average Price. In your case, the raw material has a moving average price of 1801 JPY. But the Purchasing Info Record is not used directly in production order costing which is 1800 JPY. Therefore, the production order picked up 1801 JPY, leading to a total of 180100 JPY for 10 units of ZFG004.

If you want cost estimates and production orders to align, consider:

  • Switching raw material to Standard Price (S) or
  • configure your costing variant to use MAP instead of PIR.

This ensures consistency across planning and execution.

entry.title: Hide/display fields depending of active/draft status of an entity using Metadata extension
entry.content:
Hi,

I have a very simple requirement for a RAP application. I have to fields, one must be displayed only for the draft (inactive) version and the other one displayed only for the active version.

In the metadata extension i was able to implement this behavior for the first field using this syntax (hidden for active version, thus displayed only in draft mode)

@ui.hidden: #(IsActiveEntity)

But i could not make it work of the second field which must be displayed only in active version (hidden if draft)
I tried different variants of this syntax but nothing works
@ui.hidden:  NOT #(IsActiveEntity) 

Do you have any idea of implementation ?

Thank you

entry.title: Re: SAP BW 7.5 to BDC (BW PCE)
entry.content:
Hello, I may have no answer rather would like to point you to recent ASUG webinar about BW modernization: Ask Me Anything: SAP BW ‚Äì Your Questions on Data Warehousing, Modernization, and What‚Äôs Next - ASUG if you are ASUG member you can access it and perhaps it will help you.

entry.title: Re: New Pipeline Concept features with version 1.0.12: improved handling of Custom Header Properties
entry.content:
@ChingHong thanks for suggestions. I've prepared a draft version of script collection that can be used in interface-specific IFlows copies from the templates. It contains original add Custom Headers script, a script to add audit logs or attach audit log, and 2 scripts per your proposal:

1) create properties from encoded custom headers.

2) read string parameters from Partner Directory - the only thing that you need to set the parameters which you would like to read with a content modifier as properties with prefix "pidStringParameter_" and any dummy value. Script will replace the dummy value to the actual one from Partner Directory.

Please have a look at script collection and let me know your concerns if any:

entry.title: SAP ui5 apps migration from WEBIDE to BTP BAS while deploying getting 403 error
entry.content:
Hi all,

we are trying to migrate apps from webide to BTP BAS.

step1: we are exported project from webide.

step2: we imported into BAS and then started migration and selected the S08 destination.

step3: after selecting the destination we have run the terminal and given npm i command.

step4: now we have done another comand npx fiori add deploy-config.

step5: now we have run npm run deploy command and gave "Yes".

step6:now we have got an error that Request failed with status code 403. Guided Answers troubleshooting guide available at https://ga.support.sap.com/dtp/viewer/index.html#/tree/3046/actions/57266

entry.title: Introducing Buildless Mode in the Kyma Serverless Module
entry.content:
Kyma Serverless is evolving! We have just rolled out a new version of the Serverless module (1.8.2) with a new opt-in feature called buildless mode.
We invite you to try it out, as it allows you to experience faster, simpler, and more secure serverless development. Here‚Äôs why you should give it a try.

 

Faster Function Startup

Functions start much quicker! This means you can iterate faster, reducing the time between writing code and seeing it run. While dependency resolution now happens at Pod startup, the expensive image build step is gone. Our tests show that a simple Function with one dependency is ready in about 10 seconds.

 

Preserving Resources

No More In-Cluster Docker Builds

Function container images are no longer built inside the Kyma environment, saving significant computational resources. Docker builds are typically resource-intensive, and eliminating them frees up your cluster for what matters most‚Äîrunning your workloads.

No Need to Store Function Images

Buildless mode removes the requirement for an external Docker registry. If you previously used an in-cluster registry, you‚Äôll also save on storage resources, as Function images are no longer stored anywhere.

 

Enhanced Security

Without build jobs, Functions can run in namespaces with more restrictive Pod security levels, making your workloads safer by default.

 

How Does It Work?

Kyma provides ready-to-use Function runtime images with dedicated mount points for your custom logic and dependencies. When a Function Pod starts:

  • your dependencies are resolved and mounted at startup,

  • your custom Function code is also mounted into the serving framework at startup.

This means your code and dependencies are injected directly into the running environment, skipping the build and push steps entirely.

 

More Outcomes and Considerations

Deprecated Fields

All fields deprecated in the Serverless 1.6.0 release are no longer functional in buildless mode. For the full list of deprecated fields, See the Serverless 1.8.0 What's New note.

Scaling

Buildless mode does not support autoscaling based on CPU consumption out of the box. However, since the Function CRD supports the `/scale` subresource, you can still scale your Functions using your own HPAs or leverage KEDA‚Äôs ScaledObject API for advanced, event-driven scaling strategies. To learn how to scale your Functions using external scalers, see the Use External Scalers tutorial.

 

How to Enable Buildless Mode


Enabling buildless mode is simple!
Just add the following annotation to your Serverless custom resource:

 
serverless.kyma-project.io/buildless-mode: "enabled"

You can do this via Kyma Dashboard or with kubectl. If you want to switch back, simply remove the annotation. For more information, see Configuring Serverless.

 

What‚Äôs Next?

Currently (v1.8): Buildless mode is opt-in. Try it out and share your feedback!
Coming Soon (v1.9): We plan to make buildless mode the default mode, with an option to opt out if needed.
Future (v2.0): Our ultimate goal is to go fully buildless for all Kyma Serverless workloads.
Give buildless mode a try today and experience a faster, simpler, and more secure way to run Serverless Functions in Kyma!

 
For more information, see Serverless Buildless Mode.

entry.title: Re: TM Public Cloud - Transportation cockpit enhancement...
entry.content:
Hi @zsoci 

Thank you for your question.

You do not have the possibility in SAP S/4HANA Cloud by using standard configuration to enhance the field catalog in the Transportation Cockpit. That means the standard configuration will not enable you add custom fields from Sales order. The public cloud version currently restricts cockpit enhancements and UI adaptations for the Transportation Cockpit. Public Cloud provides flexible adaptation either through in-app extensibility or by adapting through UI for some apps but not for TM Cockpit.

The on-premise solution, however, does offer those enhancement features. Which allow you to customise the cockpit to suit your layout ID config desires.

You can consider either raising an SAP Customer Influence Request if this feature is critical for your operations or using Reporting Apps to leveraging embedded analytics, custom reports or OData outbound to enable you display this data somewhere else.

Consult the links below for more details.

Transportation Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition 2308

Equipment Categories in SAP S/4HANA Cloud

Define Field Catalogs for Transportation Cockpit

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: MRP not considering batch length Correctly
entry.content: Hi Ninad, Thank you for your answer and your proposition. However, the raw material is used in several finished products, and each finished product requires a different raw material length. Therefore, it cannot be fixed in the material master data.
